snippet: Officials said that as African Union and Somali troops moved in, Shabab fighters fled a port town used to import arms and fighters.
abstract: African Union and Somali troops take control of Baraawe, port town on southern coast of Somalia used by Shabab militant group to bring in arms and fighters from abroad.
lead_paragraph: Officials said that as African Union and Somali troops moved in, Shabab fighters fled a port town used to import arms and fighters.

headline.main: Somali Town Is Reclaimed From Shabab Militants
headline.print_headline: Somali Port Is Reclaimed From Group of Militants
